snippet: Three white officers accused in a federal civil rights lawsuit of beating a black Pittsburgh high school student falsely arrested him but did not use excessive force, a jury found Monday.
abstract: Jury in Pennsylvania finds that three white Pittsburgh police officers falsely arrested black high school student Jordan Miles but did not use excessive force; awards Miles $119,000 in damages.
lead_paragraph: Three white officers accused in a federal civil rights lawsuit of beating a black Pittsburgh high school student falsely arrested him but did not use excessive force, a jury found Monday.

headline.main: Pennsylvania: Split Verdict in False Arrest Suit
headline.print_headline: Pennsylvania: Split Verdict in False Arrest Suit
